skill.name: doc-writer
skill.description: Create or update numbered task docs using repo context, DOC_TEMPLATE.md, and naming conventions.
skill.summary: Create or update numbered task docs using repo context, DOC_TEMPLATE.md, and naming conventions.
skill.author: 0xhiroki

security_audit.summary: This is a pure documentation skill with no executable code. The static analyzer flagged 20 false positives due to pattern matching on file paths and URL strings in markdown and JSON. No network calls, file system operations, external commands, or cryptographic operations exist in these files. Only plain text documentation and metadata.

content.value_statement: Manual documentation takes time and often becomes outdated. This skill automates creation of numbered task docs using templates and repository context, ensuring consistent structure and accurate references.
actual_capabilities: Reads DOC_TEMPLATE.md to understand required document structure
Gathers context from PLAN.md and AGENTS.md files
Creates numbered task docs in docs/planned/ and docs/completed/ directories
Follows naming convention NN-task-name.md with unique two-digit prefixes
Links to existing code instead of duplicating content
Validates document structure against markdown lint rules
limitations: Requires DOC_TEMPLATE.md to exist in docs/ directory
Cannot create documentation without existing repository context files
Does not execute validators or tests automatically
Only generates markdown files, not other documentation formats

use_cases.title: Maintain consistent task tracking
use_cases.description: Generate standardized task documents that track planned and completed work across your project.

use_cases.title: Enforce documentation standards
use_cases.description: Ensure all tasks follow the same structure with proper metadata, objectives, and completion criteria.

use_cases.title: Document implementation details
use_cases.description: Create implementation step documentation with validation criteria and reference links to existing code.

prompt_templates.title: Create new task doc
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a new task document for [task name] in docs/planned/ using DOC_TEMPLATE.md. Number it sequentially after existing tasks and include context from PLAN.md.

prompt_templates.title: Mark task complete
prompt_templates.prompt: Move task [task-name] from docs/planned/ to docs/completed/ and update the document to reflect what was actually implemented.

prompt_templates.title: Refresh stale doc
prompt_templates.prompt: Review and update the task document at [path] to reflect current repository state, tests, and tooling requirements.

prompt_templates.title: Generate from context
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a complete task document for [feature] using DOC_TEMPLATE.md. Gather context from PLAN.md, AGENTS.md, and relevant source files. Link to existing code rather than duplicating.

output_examples.input: Create a new task document for user authentication feature using DOC_TEMPLATE.md
output: ‚Ä¢ Metadata block includes task number, status, and date
‚Ä¢ Implementation steps reference existing auth modules

best_practices: Always read DOC_TEMPLATE.md first to ensure proper structure
Link to existing code files instead of copying large excerpts
Verify acceptance criteria match current repository state
Use unique two-digit prefixes to avoid naming conflicts
anti_patterns: Creating docs without checking existing numbering sequence
Duplicating large code blocks instead of linking to source
Skipping the metadata block or required template sections
Failing to validate against DOC_TEMPLATE.md structure

faq.question: What templates are required for this skill to work?
faq.answer: DOC_TEMPLATE.md must exist in the docs/ directory with the expected structure including metadata, sections, and formatting.

faq.question: What file naming format is enforced?
faq.answer: Files must use the format NN-task-name.md where NN is a unique two-digit number and the name is lowercase with hyphens.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with my CI/CD pipeline?
faq.answer: This skill runs within your AI assistant. You can add validation steps to your pipeline that check docs/ structure.

faq.question: Does this skill modify existing files?
faq.answer: Yes, it can update existing task documents when moving from planned to completed or refreshing stale documentation.

faq.question: What happens if numbering conflicts occur?
faq.answer: The skill attempts to find the next available unique number, but you should verify numbering consistency manually.

faq.question: How is this different from a documentation generator?
faq.answer: This skill follows a specific template and naming convention for task tracking rather than generating general API docs.
